text: is a former Japanese football player. ==Biography== Amano was born in Gifu Prefecture on April 22, 1985. After graduating from Waseda University, she joined Nadeshiko League club TEPCO Mareeze in 2008. However, the club was disbanded for Fukushima nuclear disaster in 2011. In 2012, she moved to new club Vegalta Sendai. She retired end of 2013 season.Vegalta Sendai Amano was selected Japan national team for 2007 World Cup. However she could not play in the match. ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1985 births Category:Living people Category:Footballers from Gifu Prefecture Category:Nadeshiko League players Category:TEPCO Mareeze players Category:Mynavi Sendai Ladies players Category:2007 FIFA Women's World Cup players
title: Misaki Amano
